categories.name: Prompt Engineering
categories.description: Creating effective prompts and interactions with AI

categories.name: AI Ethics
categories.description: Responsible and ethical use of AI technologies

categories.name: Technical Concepts
categories.description: Understanding how AI works and its technical underpinnings

categories.name: Practical Applications
categories.description: Real-world use cases and applications of AI

questions.text: I've used at least three different AI chat tools and can compare their relative strengths
I regularly edit and personalize AI-generated text rather than using it verbatim
I've identified specific topics where AI consistently gives me better answers than web searches
I've experimented with different phrasings of the same question to improve AI responses
I've asked AI to explain a complex concept in multiple ways until I understood it
I've used AI to translate not just words but cultural context between languages
I've caught an AI confidently stating something false and know how to reduce these hallucinations
I've identified at least three tasks in my regular routine that AI tools help me complete faster
I know which AI features I'm willing to pay for versus which free options meet my needs
I deliberately use AI as a brainstorming partner to generate ideas I wouldn't have thought of alone
I've used AI to summarize long articles and retained the key points
I understand that tokens are the basic units processed by AI models and impact pricing
I've asked AI to critique my writing and implemented its suggestions
I've used AI to convert unstructured information into organized formats (lists, tables, etc.)
I've asked AI to generate multiple options for a decision I needed to make
I know that AI can hallucinate false information that sounds plausible and convincing
I've used AI-generated visuals (images, charts) in my personal or professional projects
I've compared how different AI tools translate the same text and noted the differences
I've used AI to simplify technical language for non-expert audiences
I understand that AI works by predicting text patterns rather than truly reasoning or understanding
I've used AI as a Dungeon Master or game master to run a tabletop RPG session
I've had AI explain the rules of a complex board game and answer my questions during gameplay
I've used AI to generate unique character backstories or NPCs for gaming
I've created a fantasy sports strategy or draft plan with AI assistance
I've used AI to suggest and plan themed parties or events with creative elements
I've developed a personal set of preferences for how I like AI to format its responses to me
I've used AI to help me learn a new concept by asking progressively deeper questions
I've successfully used AI to extract specific information from complex documents
I've deliberately experimented with AI tools outside my comfort zone to discover new capabilities
I've scheduled regular AI-powered check-ins for projects or learning goals
I transform vague instructions into specific, measurable requests with examples of desired outputs
I intentionally keep my prompts concise while including essential details for quality results
I create reusable prompt templates with variables that I can swap out for different situations
I've asked AI to critique its own answers and used that feedback to craft better questions
I've discovered which visual formats (bullets, tables, etc.) help me absorb AI-generated information best
I've had AI design a scavenger hunt or puzzle game for friends or family
I've used AI to create personalized workout routines or training plans
I've generated travel itineraries with AI that included hidden gems or local experiences
I've used AI to compose custom birthday messages or poems for loved ones
I've had AI suggest recipes based on ingredients I already have at home
I've optimized my prompts to reduce token usage and lower my costs
I've successfully delegated routine tasks to AI while focusing my time on work that requires human judgment
I've analyzed how a specific AI implementation could improve processes in my work or personal projects
I've used AI to prepare for a difficult conversation by role-playing multiple perspectives
I've generated a creative project (story, art, music) with AI that I was proud to share publicly
I understand that base models generate text based on patterns while instruction-tuned models are specifically trained to follow directions
I know that different AI models have varying context window sizes, limiting how much text they can consider at once
I use role/context instructions in prompts (e.g., "Act as a project coach") to get more appropriate responses
I've built a personal collection of effective prompts for recurring needs
I deliberately use "zero-shot" (no examples), "one-shot" (one example), or "few-shot" (multiple examples) prompting depending on the task complexity
I've used AI to create custom coloring pages or simple games for children
I've generated AI art in a specific style and framed it or displayed it in my home
I've used AI to help plan a garden or landscape design for my space
I've created a custom trivia game with AI generated questions on topics my friends enjoy
I've used AI to generate personalized book or movie recommendations beyond the mainstream
I understand that "chain-of-thought" prompting asks the AI to show step-by-step reasoning for better results
I've used temperature settings to control the creativity versus predictability of AI responses
I've compared two different AI models on the same complex task and analyzed their performance differences
I've generated custom images with AI by refining my prompts through multiple iterations
I've used AI to help design or plan an event, trip, or project from start to finish
I've asked AI to help me understand opposing viewpoints on a topic I'm exploring
I deliberately ask AI to "think step-by-step" when solving complex problems
I've used AI to create personalized learning materials tailored to my learning style
I've diagnosed and fixed a case where AI gave me poor quality output by improving my prompt
I've helped someone else learn to use AI tools effectively
I've had AI help me interpret my dreams by exploring possible meanings and symbolism
I've used AI to create a virtual time capsule with predictions about the future
I've generated customized guided meditation scripts with AI for specific needs
I've used AI to create a family newsletter with personalized sections for each member
I've had AI help me write lyrics or compose music for fun or special occasions
I break complex documents into smaller chunks with strategic overlap for more accurate AI analysis
I use deliberate multi-turn conversations with AI where each response informs my next prompt
I deliberately test different "system" versus "user" message formats to find what works best for my needs
I prefix my prompts with consistent role instructions that persist throughout our conversation
I've successfully taught an AI to mimic a specific writing style by providing clear examples
I structure complex prompts with clear sections (Context, Task, Format, Examples, Constraints)
I choose specific AI models based on their strengths for different types of tasks I need to complete
I recognize when to use RAG (connecting AI to external information sources) rather than relying solely on the model's knowledge
I've created a knowledge base of my best AI interactions that I reference for similar future needs
I've conducted head-to-head tests between different AI tools and documented which excels at what
I've used AI to design a custom escape room or mystery game for friends
I've created a fantasy world or fictional universe with AI assistance
I've used AI to suggest thoughtful gifts based on someone's interests and preferences
I've had AI generate creative prompts for photography or art projects
I've used AI to plan themed movie nights with complementary snacks and discussion questions
I know to use AI tools with retrieval when I need up-to-date information and fine-tuning when I need specialized capabilities
I understand that embeddings convert text into numerical vectors that capture meaning relationships
I know that "grounding" means anchoring AI responses to verified information sources
I design prompts that return structured output such as tables or JSON for easier processing
I've configured tools that let AI reference my private documents to provide personalized responses
I judge AI outputs with clear metrics like accuracy, relevance, and usefulness
I've systematically refined prompts through documented iterations to improve results
I fixed a hallucination by adding specific domain context and knowledge constraints
I've embedded AI assistance into my recurring workflows (e.g., meeting notes, research, planning)
I've measured tangible time saved or quality improvements from my AI implementations
I deliberately use "few-shot" prompting by providing multiple examples to guide AI responses
I've defined clear criteria for when to trust AI outputs versus when to verify them
I consistently provide examples in my prompts to guide the AI's output format and style
I've created a personal curriculum where AI helps me systematically develop new skills
I've implemented a feedback loop where I rate AI responses to improve future interactions
I recognize when to use "Tree-of-Thought" prompting to explore multiple reasoning paths for complex problems
I've built a ReAct-style approach that alternates between reasoning and gathering information
I combine multiple AI outputs in "ensemble prompting" to get more reliable or creative results
I've created a dashboard showing the impact of AI tools on my productivity and work quality
I've optimized my AI workflow to handle projects larger than a single context window
I run regular bias checks on my AI outputs, especially for high-stakes or sensitive topics
I use "context refreshing" techniques in long conversations to maintain focus on key information
I've reduced AI hallucinations by implementing proper grounding techniques with external data
I've implemented custom retrieval strategies to bring relevant information into context on demand
I've mentored colleagues in prompt engineering techniques, improving our team's collective AI skills
I understand that multimodal models can process multiple types of data (text, images, audio) unlike text-only models
I can differentiate between open-source models (freely available code) and closed-source models (proprietary systems)
I recognize that fine-tuning adapts an existing AI model to specialized tasks using additional training data
I recognize that "agentic AI" systems can take actions and make decisions, unlike passive chat interfaces
I understand that AI "function calling" allows models to trigger specific operations like searching databases
I know that a vector database stores text as meaning-based numerical representations rather than simple keywords
I understand that "semantic search" finds content based on meaning and context, not just matching exact words
I understand that "model drift" occurs when AI becomes less accurate over time as the world changes
I'm aware that prompt injection attacks attempt to override system instructions with user inputs
I recognize that "jailbreaking" refers to techniques that bypass an AI's safety guardrails
I understand that "hallucinations" are confident but incorrect statements that can be reduced through proper grounding
I recognize that AI models have "emergent abilities" that only appear at certain scales and weren't explicitly programmed
I understand that "benchmarking" compares AI models against standardized tests to measure capabilities
I know that "red teaming" involves deliberately trying to make an AI system fail to identify weaknesses
I recognize that "adversarial testing" uses specially crafted inputs designed to confuse AI systems
I understand that "synthetic data" is artificially generated information used to train AI when real data is unavailable
I've integrated at least three AI tools into a coordinated workflow to accomplish complex tasks
I've designed a custom AI agent that can perform multi-step tasks with minimal supervision
I've created specialized prompting strategies for different AI models based on their strengths
I've built a personal knowledge management system with AI-powered retrieval and summarization
I've conducted systematic experiments to determine optimal chunk sizes for processing large documents
I've used AI analytics to identify patterns and insights in my personal or professional data
I've developed a consistent prompt format that I've refined through systematic testing
I've automated repetitive workflows by connecting AI outputs to other digital tools
I've measured the ROI or impact metrics of my AI implementations
I've created AI-powered dashboards that track progress toward my goals
I've designed custom guardrails that balance safety with usefulness for my specific use cases
I've implemented feedback collection to iteratively improve my AI systems
I've created specialized AI tools for my team or community's unique needs
I've systematically compared AI outputs with expert human performance for quality benchmarking
I've designed AI-powered systems that combine human and machine strengths
I've led AI adoption initiatives that measurably improved processes
I've created AI-assisted creative workflows that enhance rather than replace human creativity
I've conducted thorough evaluations of AI tools before selecting ones for implementation
I've converted skeptics into AI users by demonstrating tangible benefits
I've hosted a friendly rap battle between two chatbots and judged creativity and accuracy
I've created multi-agent AI workflows where different specialized AIs collaborate on complex projects
I use techniques to mitigate "lost in the middle" effects where content in the middle gets ignored
I've designed and implemented AI guardrails that balance safety with useful output for my use cases
I've automated note capture from live meetings with AI summaries integrated into my project tools
I've red-teamed my own AI systems to identify and patch potential security vulnerabilities
I've fine-tuned a model to specialize in my domain with carefully curated training examples
I consider compute efficiency and carbon footprint when choosing between AI implementation options
I've integrated AI capabilities into existing tools using APIs rather than only using standalone interfaces
I've created specialized tooling to optimize context window usage for my specific applications
I know that "Constitutional AI" techniques establish rules and principles the AI should follow
I've developed methods to extract and persist key information across multiple AI sessions
I've conducted or participated in formal AI ethics assessments of systems
I've created guidelines for responsible AI use in my team or organization
I've created an AI adoption roadmap with clear milestones and success metrics
I've experimented with running local AI models to compare with cloud-based options
I've implemented a retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) system that connects AI to my knowledge base
I've used AI agents that can perform actions across multiple systems based on natural language requests
I've implemented AI monitoring and observability tools to ensure quality and performance
I understand the environmental impact of large AI models and factor this into my decisions
I've developed novel prompting techniques beyond standard approaches
I strategically design multi-stage AI workflows to handle tasks larger than a single context window
I know that human evaluation protocols systematically gather feedback about AI outputs
I've designed AI interfaces that optimize for human-AI collaboration rather than just automation
I've created ensemble systems that combine multiple AI models for improved reliability
I've developed domain-specific benchmarks to evaluate AI performance for my use cases
I've created synthetic training data to overcome limitations in available real-world data
I've implemented comprehensive prompt injection protection for production AI systems
I've designed AI systems that explicitly show their reasoning and sources
I've created AI-powered innovation processes that systematically explore new possibilities
I've developed AI augmentation tools that enhance human capabilities rather than replacing them
I've built systems where AI and humans collaborate with clear handoff protocols
I've created pipelines to continuously improve AI systems based on user feedback
I've designed techniques to effectively analyze and interpret very large AI-generated outputs
I've developed methods to identify and mitigate various forms of bias in AI systems
I've created domain-specific prompt engineering guidelines for my field
I've developed AI systems that can explain their outputs in terms non-experts can understand
I've designed AI-powered processes that demonstrably improve decision quality
I've created AI learning environments that adapt to individual learning styles and pace
I've built AI systems that can transfer knowledge between different domains
I've developed methodologies to evaluate hallucination rates in specific AI applications
I've designed AI systems that appropriately express uncertainty rather than false confidence
I've created AI-powered coaching systems that help people develop new skills
I've implemented AI systems that can recognize and adapt to different user expertise levels
I've developed techniques to combine human expertise with AI capabilities in optimal ways
I've created systems where AI handles routine cases and escalates edge cases to humans
I've built AI workflows that learn from and incorporate diverse perspectives
I've developed methods for AI to effectively work with ambiguous or incomplete information
I've created AI systems that actively seek clarification when faced with ambiguous requests
I've developed an AI testing framework that comprehensively evaluates performance across diverse scenarios
I've established personal guidelines for when to disclose my use of AI in creating content
I've developed a framework for appropriately attributing AI contributions to my work
I've created protocols for handling sensitive information when using AI tools
I've established clear boundaries about tasks I won't delegate to AI for ethical reasons
I've developed a personal framework for assessing the societal impact of my AI usage
I've used AI to analyze financial data and generate insights about spending patterns or investment opportunities
I've applied AI to help with legal research or contract analysis
I've used AI to assist with educational assessment or curriculum development
I've employed AI to improve healthcare management, diagnosis support, or treatment planning
I've leveraged AI for scientific research or data analysis in my field
I've used AI to bridge communication gaps between people with different native languages
I've prompted AI to adapt content for different cultural contexts and sensitivities
I've used AI to help me understand cultural nuances in international communications
I've prompted AI in multiple languages to compare quality of responses across languages
I've used AI to create localized versions of content for different regional audiences
I've established shared prompt libraries or templates for my team's common AI tasks
I've created collaborative workflows where multiple people contribute to and refine AI prompts
I've developed standards for AI usage consistency across a team or organization
I've created training materials to help others in my organization use AI effectively
I've facilitated workshops or sessions to help teams integrate AI into their workflows
I've used AI to help debug or troubleshoot technical problems in systems or code
I've employed AI for data cleaning, normalization, or preparation tasks
I've used AI to generate synthetic test data for software development or testing
I've applied AI to automate repetitive aspects of coding or development workflows
I've used AI to help document, explain, or comment on technical systems or code
I've used AI to challenge my assumptions or identify potential cognitive biases in my thinking
I've employed AI as a Socratic questioning partner to deepen my understanding of complex topics
I've created spaced repetition learning systems with AI to help me retain information
I've used AI to generate thought experiments that expand my perspective on a topic
I've developed personal AI coaching systems that help me improve specific skills
I've created workflows that combine text and image AI to generate illustrated content
I've used AI to convert content between modalities (e.g., text to speech, images to text)
I've employed AI to analyze multimedia content and extract insights across modalities
I've used AI to help design multimodal presentations or communications
I've prompted AI to create synchronized multimedia experiences (e.g., narration with visuals)
I've maintained a log of my AI experiments and insights over time
I've created a personal roadmap for developing specific AI skills I want to acquire
I've systematically tested boundary cases to understand AI limitations
I've conducted A/B testing to optimize AI workflows for specific outcomes
I've established metrics to track my improving effectiveness with AI tools over time
I've implemented verification steps for factual claims made by AI before using them
I've analyzed potential bias in AI systems I use and taken steps to mitigate it
I've used AI for customer service enhancement or support automation
I've applied AI to supply chain or operations optimization
I've used AI to enhance marketing content or analyze campaign performance
